newsitem.title: USA: East Pacific storm upgraded to hurricane - WSC.
newsitem.headline: East Pacific storm upgraded to hurricane - WSC.

text.p: Tropical storm Dolores has been upgraded to hurricane status in the eastern Pacific, independent forecaster Weather Services Corp said on Monday.
It does not threaten land, but it is a threat to shipping, WSC said.
The hurricane, with 75 mph winds, is centred about 800 miles southwest of the southern tip of Baja California, Mexico, moving west-northwest at 13 mph.
It will continue to track out to sea to the west-northwest, strengthening slightly during the next 12 hours, then slowly weakening.
